page.title: 01AN INTRODUCTION TO QUERNMORE
page.content: Our area is hilly,with Clougha Pike 1325 feet high and the fells beyond rising to 1500 feet.From Clougha you get a lovely view of Quernmore valley,the city of Lancaster and the Lake District hills.On a really clear day you can see the Isle of Man.Quite a lot of the fells belong to the Duke of Westminster and his gamekeepers rear grouse. There are six farms which mostly have sheep because it is hilly but they also have cattle.On one of the farms lives Mr.Tim Longton who is a very famous sheep dog handler. In Roman times the Romans made quernstones from the hard rock and that's where Quernmore got its name from.It isn't pronounced like you'd expect,it rhymes with warmer.
